entry.title: Indroducing Hosts File Editor
entry.summary: NETworkManager 2025.8.10.0 introduced a new feature, the Hosts File Editor. You can now easily manage and edit your system's hosts file in a user-friendly interface.
entry.content:
NETworkManager 2025.8.10.0 introduced a new feature, the Hosts File Editor. You can now easily manage and edit your system's hosts file in a user-friendly interface.

As a sysadmin or developer, you often need to modify the hosts file in order to override DNS settings for specific domains, redirect traffic, or test websites locally.

The hosts file is a plain text file used by the operating system to map hostnames to IP addresses. It is typically located at:

  • Windows: C:\Windows\System32\drivers\etc\hosts
  • Linux: /etc/hosts

Editing this file usually requires administrative privileges and can be cumbersome using traditional text editors. With the new Hosts File Editor in NETworkManager, you can now easily add, edit, enable, disable, or delete entries in your hosts file without needing to manually open and edit the file.

A daily backup (up to 5 versions) of the hosts file is created automatically before any changes are applied, allowing you to restore previous versions if needed.

Upgrade now to the latest version of NETworkManager to use this feature.

More information is available in the official documentation.

entry.title: Introducing Code Signing for Binaries
entry.summary: Starting with NETworkManager version 2024.5.24.0, the binaries and the installer are now signed with a code signing certificate.
entry.content:
Starting with NETworkManager version 2024.5.24.0, the binaries and the installer are now signed with a code signing certificate.

The binaries and installer are built on AppVeyor directly from the GitHub repository. Build artifacts are automatically sent to SignPath.io via webhook, where they are signed after manual approval by the maintainer. The signed binaries are then uploaded to the GitHub releases page.

Special thanks goes to SignPath.io for providing free code signing and the SignPath Foundation for the free code signing certificate.
